title: New Zealand's Steve Hansen 'happy' to avoid Japan's bold hearts and free running in World Cup quarter-finals
text:
Japan were paid the ultimate compliment the morning after victory over Scotland when Steve Hansen, the All Black head coach, said he was “happy” to avoid the Brave Blossoms in this week’s quarter-finals.

As rugby swooned over Japan’s Pool A triumph - played four, won four - the All Blacks were contemplating a quarter-final tie against Ireland while observing something of their own artistry in the exuberance of the hosts. Super fast attacking and audacious handling were Japan’s chief weapons in the 28-21 win over Scotland, after which their label as a “Tier-two” nation needs tearing...
description: Japan were paid the ultimate compliment the morning after victory over Scotland when Steve Hansen, the All Black head coach, said he was “happy” to avoid the Brave Blossoms in this week’s quarter-finals.
